author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sri Ramakrishna Hospital will operate the emergency medical assistance booth round-the-clock at the Coimbatore Railway Junction.

The hospital will depute trained medical staff to provide emergency first aid, and would assist in transferring them to a hospital of their choice, if needed. The booth will have ECG monitors, SPO2 monitors, defibrillator, drugs and IV fluids.Such booths are already functioning in Salem, Erode and Karur junctions of Salem Railway Division. The booth was inaugurated by the Coimbatore Corporation Commissioner K. Vijayakarthikeyan. R. Vijayakumhar, managing trustee of SNR Sons Charitable Trust; V. Ramakrishna, chief operating officer; Ramkumar, chief executive officer; Dr. Sukumaran, dean of the hospital; and Chinnaraj, Station Manager of Coimbatore Railway Junction; were present.
title: Medical aid at railway station
